title: Prepositions of Time: in, on, at
description: Слушайте и различайте предлоги времени in, on, at.

tasks.audioText: I have an early start tomorrow. My meeting is at nine o'clock.
tasks.transcript: My meeting is at nine o'clock.

options.text: The meeting is in the afternoon.
The meeting is at a specific time — nine.
The meeting is on Monday.
The meeting was yesterday at nine.

tasks.explanation: 'At' is used with exact times: at nine o'clock.

tasks.audioText: We are planning a trip. We are going to Spain in July.
tasks.transcript: We are going to Spain in July.

options.text: They are going to Spain on a specific day.
They are going to Spain during the month of July.
They went to Spain last July.
They are going to France in July.

tasks.explanation: 'In' is used with months: in July.

tasks.audioText: I have a dentist appointment. It is on Wednesday this week.
tasks.transcript: It is on Wednesday this week.

options.text: The appointment is at a specific hour.
The appointment is in the morning.
The appointment is on a specific day — Wednesday.
The appointment was last Wednesday.

tasks.explanation: 'On' is used with days of the week: on Wednesday.

tasks.audioText: I love quiet hours. I usually read books at night.
tasks.transcript: I usually read books at night.

options.text: The person reads in the morning.
The person reads during the night time.
The person reads on Sundays.
The person never reads.

tasks.explanation: 'At night' means during the dark hours of the day.

tasks.audioText: My birthday is special this year. It is on the fifteenth of March.
tasks.transcript: It is on the fifteenth of March.

options.text: The birthday is in March but no date is given.
The birthday is at three o'clock.
The birthday is on a specific date — March fifteenth.
The birthday was in February.

tasks.explanation: 'On' is used with specific dates: on the fifteenth of March.

tasks.audioText: The weather is cold now. It always snows here in winter.
tasks.transcript: It always snows here in winter.

options.text: It snows during the winter season.
It snows on one specific day.
It snows at noon.
It never snows here.

tasks.explanation: 'In winter' refers to the whole season.

tasks.audioText: I enjoy mornings at the cafe. I always have breakfast at half past seven.
tasks.transcript: I always have breakfast at half past seven.

options.text: Breakfast is in the afternoon.
Breakfast is on Saturdays only.
Breakfast is at a specific time — seven thirty.
The person skips breakfast.

tasks.explanation: 'At half past seven' is a specific time — 7:30.

tasks.audioText: I am getting ready for work. I exercise in the morning before work.
tasks.transcript: I exercise in the morning before work.

options.text: The person exercises at night.
The person exercises during the morning hours.
The person exercises on Fridays.
The person does not exercise.

tasks.explanation: 'In the morning' means during the early part of the day.

tasks.audioText: We have family traditions. We always have a big dinner on Christmas Day.
tasks.transcript: We always have a big dinner on Christmas Day.

options.text: The family has dinner in December but no day is given.
The family has dinner at midnight.
The family does not celebrate Christmas.
The family has a big dinner on a specific holiday.

tasks.explanation: 'On Christmas Day' uses 'on' for a specific named day.

tasks.audioText: I was born a long time ago. I was born in nineteen ninety-five.
tasks.transcript: I was born in nineteen ninety-five.

options.text: The person was born on a specific date.
The person was born in the year 1995.
The person was born at five o'clock.
The person was born in 2005.

tasks.explanation: 'In' is used with years: in nineteen ninety-five.

tasks.audioText: The city is quiet now. The shops close at six o'clock in the evening.
tasks.transcript: The shops close at six o'clock in the evening.

options.text: The shops close at a specific time — six PM.
The shops close in the morning.
The shops are open all night.
The shops close on Sundays only.

tasks.explanation: 'At six o'clock in the evening' combines a specific time with a part of the day.

tasks.audioText: We have a school concert. It will be on Friday afternoon.
tasks.transcript: It will be on Friday afternoon.

options.text: The concert is at noon exactly.
The concert is on a specific day — Friday.
The concert is in the summer.
The concert was last Friday.

tasks.explanation: 'On Friday afternoon' uses 'on' with a specific day and time of day.

tasks.audioText: I work long hours during the week. I relax at the weekend.

options.text: The person relaxes during Saturday and Sunday.
The person relaxes in the morning only.
The person relaxes on Mondays.
The person never relaxes.

tasks.explanation: 'At the weekend' means during Saturday and Sunday.

tasks.audioText: I love autumn colours. The leaves change colour in October.
tasks.transcript: The leaves change colour in October.

options.text: The leaves change on one specific day.
The leaves change during the month of October.
The leaves change at three o'clock.
The leaves change in summer.

tasks.audioText: Our flight is very early. The plane leaves at five in the morning.
tasks.transcript: The plane leaves at five in the morning.

options.text: The plane departs at a specific early time — five AM.
The plane leaves in the evening.
The plane leaves on Monday.
The plane leaves at five PM.

tasks.explanation: 'At five in the morning' means the departure is at 5:00 AM.

short_description: Prepositions of Time: in, on, at с временными выражениями
